USA: Battle of Hampton Roads: A naval battle between the Monitor and Merrimack takes place.
The Morrill Land-Grant Colleges Act is passed.
General Robert E. Lee is placed in command of the Army of Northern Virginia.
Second Battle of Bull Run: The battle takes place.
Battle of Antietam: The battle takes place.
Dakota War of 1862: The war is fought.
Slovenia: The railway line of the "Carintnhian railway" on the route Maribor – Vuzenica is built.
Philippine: El Pasig is published, a bilingual fortnightly paper, one of the first native newspapers.
Rafaél de Echagüe y Bermingham appointed Governor-General (1862–1865)
Japan: Namamugi Incident: Four British subjects were attacked by guards on the Tōkaidō for failing to pay proper respect to a daimyō. One, a merchant named Charles Lennox Richardson, was killed.
China: Dungan Revolt: A disordered uprising began among the Hui people living on the west bank of the Yellow River.
The Tongwen Guan school of European languages was established.
Bhutan: Bhutanese forces raid Sikkim and Cooch Behar; the British respond by withholding all compensation payments and demanding release of all captives and return of stolen property. These demands went unheeded by the Druk Desi, as he was alleged to be unaware of frontier officials' raids.
Australia: Stuart reached Port Darwin, founding a settlement there. Queensland's western border was moved to 139° E.
